title: Confusing note "use occurs due to use in closure"

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
Ideally, it would say something like "value used here in closure".

### Code

[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=7d868154f4b5fbd59150bc2e5e52ef8a)

```rust
fn main() {
    let x = vec![42];
    let _y = x;
    let _f = || { x; };
}
```

### Output

```
error[E0382]: use of moved value: `x`
 --> src/main.rs:4:14
  |
2 |     let x = vec![42];
  |         - move occurs because `x` has type `Vec<i32>`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
3 |     let _y = x;
  |              - value moved here
4 |     let _f = || { x; };
  |              ^^   - use occurs due to use in closure
  |              |
  |              value used here after move
```

### Meta

This seems to have regressed a while ago, in Rust 1.36.0. In Rust 1.35.0, the error looked like this:

```
error[E0382]: capture of moved value: `x`
 --> <source>:4:19
  |
3 |     let _y = x;
  |         -- value moved here
4 |     let _f = || { x; };
  |                   ^ value captured here after move
  |
  = note: move occurs because `x` has type `std::vec::Vec<i32>`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
```
